greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Eigentriangle, row sums = the Padovan sequence, A000931
comment: Right border = Padovan sequence starting with offset 6.
Row sums = Padovan sequence starting with offset 7.
Sum of n-th row terms = rightmost term of next row.
formula: Triangle read by rows, T(n,k) = M * (A000931 * 0^(n-k)). M = an infinite lower triangular matrix with A106510 in every column: (1, 1, -1, 0, 1, -1, 0, 1, -1,...); and A000931 is a diagonalized infinite lower triangular matrix with the Padovan sequence starting with offset 6: (1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 9,...) as the main diagonal and the rest zeros.
example: First few rows of the triangle =

Example: Row 10 = (1, 0, -2, 2, 3) with A000931(10) = 3, rightmost term. This row = the termwise products of ((1, 0, -1, 1, 1) and (1, 1, 2, 2, 3); where the Padovan sequence starting with offset 6 = (1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 9,...).
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Oct 10 2008
